fun.connor.lighter.compiler.generator.endpoint

Class ControllerGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • fun.connor.lighter.compiler.generator.endpoint.ControllerGenerator

  • public class ControllerGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    Generator for ResourceController annotated classes. Since these classes are not required to conform to any interface, this generator uses extra data to generate endpoint method calls. This allows the class to represent any ResourceController and any endpoint method call with the same interface.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • ControllerGenerator

        public ControllerGenerator(javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror type,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String endpointMethodName,
                           javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror endpointRetType)
        Construct a new controller generator for the given ResourceController annotated type. Also required is a name for the field to store the controller at runtime, the name of the endpoint method that this generator will be generating, and that endpoint's return type.
        Parameters:
        type - the controller's type
        name - the name of the field this generator generates
        endpointMethodName - the name of the endpoint method to call
        endpointRetType - the return type of the endpoint.

        public Assignable makeAssignable()
        Make an Assignable element to assign to the field this generator controls

        an Assignable for the field

      • makeExpression

        public Expression makeExpression()
        Make an expression to read the field.
        Returns:
        an expression with the value of the field

      • makeEndpointCall

        public Expression makeEndpointCall(java.util.List<Expression> arguments)
        Generate an expression that represents a function call to the endpoint method on the field. The argument list is provided in the order used in the final generated source code. Each expression in the list should produce the value of the argument in its position.
        Parameters:
        arguments - the ordered argument list
        Returns:
        an expression representing the method call with the provided arguments.
